skill.name: device-management
skill.description: Manage device adoption and onboarding, maintain device inventory, and monitor device configurations across your UniFi network infrastructure.
skill.summary: Manage device adoption and onboarding, maintain device inventory, and monitor device configurations ...
skill.author: DataKnifeAI

security_audit.summary: This skill is a pure markdown documentation file describing available MCP tools. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access is implemented in this skill. The actual functionality is provided by the UniFi Network MCP server which should be reviewed separately.

content.value_statement: Managing UniFi network devices requires accessing multiple controller APIs and managing complex adoption workflows. This skill provides unified access to device adoption, inventory tracking, and monitoring tools for efficient network administration.
actual_capabilities: List devices pending adoption into the network
View all adopted network devices with status information
Get detailed device specifications and firmware versions
Monitor UniFi controller status and health metrics
Track device inventory organized by type and location
Plan hardware upgrades based on device age and performance
limitations: Requires UniFi Network MCP server to be running and configured
API access depends on UniFi controller availability and credentials
Cannot perform device adoption actions (read-only queries only)
Site ID handling may require manual configuration for non-default sites

use_cases.title: Device Adoption Workflow
use_cases.description: Identify pending devices and plan systematic adoption into the network with proper documentation.

use_cases.title: Inventory Reports
use_cases.description: Generate comprehensive device inventory reports organized by type, location, and status for asset management.

use_cases.title: Controller Monitoring
use_cases.description: Monitor UniFi controller health, version status, and system uptime to ensure network reliability.

prompt_templates.title: Check Pending Devices
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me all devices that are pending adoption in my UniFi network.

prompt_templates.title: Device Inventory
prompt_templates.prompt: List all adopted devices in my network with their status and firmware versions.

prompt_templates.title: Device Specifications
prompt_templates.prompt: Get detailed specifications for all network devices including model, memory, and uptime.

prompt_templates.title: Upgrade Planning
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze my device inventory and recommend an upgrade plan based on device age, model, and firmware version.

output_examples.input: Show me all devices pending adoption
output: All devices are currently in factory default state and ready for adoption.

best_practices: Adopt devices in logical groups by site or function to maintain organized network structure.
Document device purpose and location during adoption for easier future maintenance.
Regularly review controller version and plan maintenance windows for firmware updates.
anti_patterns: Adopting devices without documenting their intended location and purpose.
Ignoring pending devices for extended periods leaving them in default configuration.
Performing bulk adoption without verifying device compatibility with your controller version.

faq.question: Which UniFi controller versions are supported?
faq.answer: The skill works with UniFi Network API-compatible controllers including UniFi Network 7.x and newer versions.

faq.question: What information is returned for each device?
faq.answer: Devices return MAC address, IP address, model, firmware version, uptime, status, and configuration details.

faq.question: Do I need to install additional software?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill requires the UniFi Network MCP server to be installed and configured with your controller credentials.

faq.question: Is my network data stored or transmitted?
faq.answer: No. This skill only reads data from your local UniFi controller. No device or network information is transmitted externally.

faq.question: Why do I see double slashes in API endpoints?
faq.answer: Empty site IDs appear as double slashes in API paths. This is normal behavior. Use empty string or 'default' when querying.

faq.question: How does this compare to the UniFi web interface?
faq.answer: This skill provides scriptable access to the same data as the web interface, enabling automation and integration with AI workflows.
